siteMetadata.title: Complete Intro to React
siteMetadata.subtitle: v6
siteMetadata.description: Brian Holt breaks down React into the most low level principles so that you can understand your whole stack, from front to back

frontmatter.title: Introduction
frontmatter.description: Brian Holt introduces you to himself, the Complete Intro to React version 6, and what you can expect to learn

frontmatter.title: Pure React
frontmatter.description: Brian teaches React without any frills: just you, some JavaScript, and the browser. No build step.

frontmatter.title: Components
frontmatter.description: Brian teaches React without any frills: just you, some JavaScript, and the browser. No build step.

frontmatter.title: npm
frontmatter.description: When putting any sort of JavaScript project together, npm is an essential tool. Brian talks about how to get started with npm.

frontmatter.title: Prettier
frontmatter.description: Brian talks about his favorite JS tool, Prettier, a tool that that helps you maintain consistent code style with no work on the dev's part.

frontmatter.title: ESLint
frontmatter.description: An essential part of maintaining a project a long time is discipline in coding standards and avoiding antipatterns. ESLint is a great tool that helps you do just that.

frontmatter.title: Git
frontmatter.description: Git is a critical part of any JS project and Brian makes sure you have it set up.

frontmatter.title: Parcel
frontmatter.description: Setting up a build process has historically been a big barrier to entry for most developers. Brian shows you how to set up Parcel which makes the whole process a breeze.

frontmatter.title: JSX
frontmatter.description: JSX is an essential part of writing React. Brian teaches you to leverage your newfound React knowledge and make it much easier to read with JSX
